Kernel/sources/input/keyboard_generic_ps2.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "keyboard_generic_ps2.h"
00002 #include <interrupts/irq.h>
00003 #include <interrupts/idt.h>
00004 #include <printf.h>
00005 #include <types/int_types.h>
00006 #include <input/keyboard.h>
00007 #include <input/input.h>
00008 
00009 static uint32 flags = 0;
00010 
00011 idt_call_registers_t keyboardIrqCallback(idt_call_registers_t regs) 
00012 {
00013     uint8 sc = inb(0x60);
00014     char new_char;
00015 
00016     switch(sc) {
00017         case 0x2a: 
00018             flags = flags | FLAG_SHIFT_STATE;
00019             break;
00020  
00021         case 0xaa: 
00022             flags = flags ^ FLAG_SHIFT_STATE;
00023             break;
00024 
00025         case 0xe0:
00026             flags = flags | FLAG_ESCAPED; 
00027             break;
00028 
00029         case 0x3a:
00030 
00031             if ((flags & FLAG_CAPS_LOCK))
00032             {
00033                 //Caps lock is on
00034                 flags = flags ^ FLAG_CAPS_LOCK; //Swap bit to 0 using XOR
00035             }
00036             else 
00037             {
00038                 flags = flags | FLAG_CAPS_LOCK; //Swap bit to 1 using OR
00039             }
00040 
00041             break;
00042  
00043         default:
00044            if ((flags & FLAG_ESCAPED)) 
00045            { 
00046                 flags = flags ^ FLAG_ESCAPED; /* Set the bit to 0 */
00047                 break; 
00048            }
00049            if (sc & 0x80) 
00050            {
00051               /* Ignore the break code */
00052            } 
00053            else 
00054            {
00055                 sendInputMessage(DEVICE_KEYBOARD, sc, &flags);
00056            }
00057            break;
00058      }
00059 }
00060 
00061 void initializeKeyboard() 
00062 {
00063         register_interrupt_handler(GET_IRQ(1), &keyboardIrqCallback);
00064         
00065         //Clear the existing keyboard buffer after the keyboard IRQ has been registered. Makes sure that the keyboard controller will trigger a IRQ
00066         uint8 temp, t2;
00067 
00068         while (1) 
00069         {
00070                 temp = inb(0x60);
00071                 if (temp == t2) break;
00072                 t2 = temp; 
00073         }
00074 
00075 }
